titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

p.hi: We left Wynyard at 10.45 a.m., and reached Durham only just in time for me to go to the Town Hall in order to attend the ceremonies with which a new Mayor is elected & inaugurated. These were followed by a procession to the Masonic Hall, at which light refreshments were served, and many speeches were made. I responded to the toast of the Bishop & Clergy of All Denominations (!), & was followed by a Papist & a Sectary!! Then Cruikshank took me off to the new School–house to consider divers small alterations, which Wilkinson desired.
